summary: From 2017 until January 2021, billions of dollars went to construction contracts for barriers along the U.S. Southwest border. This testimony discusses these barrier construction efforts. During that time period, the Departments of Homeland Security and Defense installed about 450 miles of barrier panels. As of January 2021, only about 15% of the panels were complete barrier systems, which include lights, patrol roads, and technology...
title: Southwest Border: Award and Management of Barrier Construction Contracts
